title: Getting caffeinated. Saving money.
text: These are exactly as pictured. They have a perfect snap to them to seal your precious ground beans in. I don't know why I didn't try these sooner.

title: This makes the ice but it. does NOT keep it FROZEN!
text: I was so excited to get this ice maker. I really thought it was going to be amazing especially for this price point. Don't get me wrong, this does exactly what the item description says it does. It makes wonderful ice and it really is just like Sonic's ice but there are some huge flaws. So, I am getting everything together to get this process going, First, this only came with a quick start guide. There is not a separate more thorough operations manual or any troubleshooting guide. Set up for me took a bit longer than it should have but having some unclear instructions was a distraction. You have to do a cleaning cycle before the ice. That was pretty easy just fill up the reservoir that is located under the ice bin to the fill line with water. Make sure the switch in the back is turned to cleaning and begin. Once that is done the extra water tank that is attached to the machine only by a magnet (which I do not like) has it's own cleaning cycle but it is not necessary to use the extra tank if you are not planning to make a lot of ice. Once the cleaning is done now it's ready to go. I started my first batch, made sure the ice was forming (it only took a couple of minutes) and went on with my day. I went back to the kitchen for a my first drink with my new ice about an hour and a half later. I see that there isn't any and there isn't any water either. I thought I must have done something wrong. So, I am scrambling around to find an answer to what us wrong. I went to the GE website and there isn't anything other than the quick start guide. Of course you can  contact support if there are any issues. I decided to start fresh so I took the plugs out of the hoses in the back and drained the water out which was trapped in the machine where I couldn't see it. I'm not sure about this but I had to have read it somewhere, I found out why there was no ice after I returned to the kitchen.  I knew the ice was forming and dropping into the bin before I left the kitchen so I know I wasn't crazy. But, this expensive appliance does not keep the ice in the bin frozen. What? The ice machine doesn't keep the ice frozen? So it only does half it's job and the bin is located inside the machine. I could understand if the bin was on the outside of the machine but the inside? So that is what happened it had all melted and the water was already recycling to make more ice. It just can't be seen. The guide states that if the water recycles it will make the ice taste bad. I really like this ice. The little pellets that form into ice make drinks taste so much better than the big bulky ice cubes do. This machine works great but I do not have time to babysit each cycle of the ice-making process. At least not at this price. To have an appliance this expensive do only half of what it should do is crazy to me. So, I wouldn't recommend this unless you gave a lot of cash to spend and a lot of time to waste but for me, this is unacceptable. I can not believe that this machine can make ice but it doesn't keep it frozen!

title: Fits my Kenmore fridge
text:
Needed a replacement for my Kenmore fridge and this one for perfectly. The water tastes great!

1 star - awful! want my money back!
2 stars - bad but not horrendous
3 stars - decent/good
4 stars - really good!
5 stars - excellent! definitely recommend!

title: Good kettle
text: The kettle is pretty basic and very easy to use. The water level indicator is on the inside etched into the steel inside wall. On the outside there is a plastic power switch that clicks off when the water is heated enough. It takes about 5 minutes to heat a kettle full of water. It fits with my kitchen decor nicely and I enjoy using it.

title: Money saver
text: I am a coffee drinker. My coffee maker indicator shows 8 cups on the container which makes 3 big cups per use. Despite this filter intended for 1-2 cups (it does look smallish), I am able to make 3 cups out of it. The filter even makes the coffee more flavorful and robust. It's easy to wash. The stitching on the sides is still holding strong after 5 or so days using it everyday. A bag of filters is about $3.00-$4.00 and it adds up at the end of each year. This is real money saver. I do so hate to discover I am out of filters early in the morning. (It did happen and I was as angry as a bear!). This is a real good find and good to have at home. I totally recommend it.

With that said, it operates super quiet and also chills in about a day once it's first plugged in. We use ours for beverage storage mostly, so that we don't have to open our main fridge as frequently, especially when we have house guests. The little freezer section allows for a handy area for random usage. The price us on the higher end of its competitors, however, it us cost effective if it holds up to its brands expected quality.

title: Does the job
text: These are lightweight and easy to clean. Each egg is protected from touching each other. They actually fit standard large eggs from grocery but not the jumbo. Keep in mind, this holder keeps the eggs separated but you will still break eggs if they get jostled such as in a camper refrigerator while traveling. Care is needed to keep the containers from jarring movements. Works great in our camper. I just wish they held a dozen instead of ten.

title: Simple and easy to use
text: These are straightforward. Wrap around the handle and seal with Velcro. Doesn't work for all handles though, not if you want it to stay in a particular spot. If the Velcro strip was wider, you wouldn't have this loose flap which takes away from a nice clean look. The wraps itself are nice, but you need either wide fridge rat or handles or other handles you could use these for. My stove has curved handles so agsin,  I can't use them there. It doesn't wrap neatly on a curve.

title: Nice dust cover
text: The material is sturdy and the design is not ostentatious. I am not a fan of the little fringe but thankfully it's small. The pouches on the sides made handy catchalls but you have to ensure there are things on top that will keep the cover from sliding off. I am happy to have covers on problem dust accumulation areas.

title: Fills the gap nicely.
text: It takes a day or two for these strips to settle nicely due to it being semi folded when shipped. The kinks do get worked out and are now blocking the gaps between my range and the counters. The black strips work best with our range and counters and I love that the silicone material is heat resistant. We have some spoon rests made of the same material and they clean up easily. So far these strips are working as expected.

title: Fits as expected
text: Almost identical to our existing filter, it works as expected. The only noticeable difference is that it doesn't snap shut as evenly as the original, however it still works. The material isn't the same grade as the original either but having another filter allows me to alternate and clean.

title: Organizer
text: This is really a handy organizer especially when you have weekend guests. Eggs are one of the few breakfast items that get depleted quickly. This 2 tray organizer holds up to 5 dozen, which is my go to amount to have on hand during the holidays. I really wish it was just a tad more rigid just so I wouldn't have to be as careful sliding the trays in and out. It's holding up well, but I can feel just a slight pliability.

title: What a godsend!
text: I am not sure how long this product has been available, but for me this is a wonderful godsend! I use these as a liner for the bottom of my electric ovens. One of the most dreaded chores for me is cleaning the oven and having these liners makes for easy and quick cleanups for the occasional debris. Definitely looking forward to seeing how long each sheet can be cleaned and reused!

title: Perfect for entertsining
text: The ice maker on the refrigerator tends to act up and only make ice when it feels like it. This portable ice maker suits the need when you need it. It won't store the ice so it is important to know you will have to remove and place in freezer ice bin or ice bucket or whatever else you need to use it for. My daughter entertains often so this machine has saved time by not having to store huge amounts of ice. Makes ice fast (within 10 minutes) so packing the kids lunch boxes has been a breeze. It does have a fan that runs so you would have to have a space that accommodates the flow of air, and it is about as noisy asan older microwave or dishwasher, but we treat it as just temporary white noise.

It's over a centimeter to far out of the fridge front, so anything would knock it off. Would have been great if it did fit.

So now I can stick it to anything and I actually have a bonus plate to use.

text: My husband installed this fan and it solved all the problems we had been having.  It is truly a great product, and I just sorry we didn't hear about it sooner.  Our dryer vent  has a long way to go to the outside wall of the house, plus a turn, and it just wasn't moving the exhaust out like it should have. Now everything is working as it was meant to.

title: Handsome Unit
text: I like that this cooktop can be used on a counter or placed in a stove. I am in the midst of a kitchen renovation and have been using it on a counter. It is sleek and handsome and cooks well. The sensor controls are not intuitive. There us a learning curve albeit not a steep one. It is not easpecially fast at heating but cooks evenly and adequately. I like it.

title: Stopped After A Week
text: This countertop is easy to set-up and use. It is quite noisy. After a week of daily use it died. Would not recommend.

title: Quick & Quiet
text: This compact unit produces two different sizes of ice. Operation could be more intuitive but it is fast and reasonably quiet. The ice tastes good. Remove the cubes promptly otherwise they melt and are recycled. Nice.

title: Small Space Help
text: This small dishwasher is ideal for small spaces. Set up was straightforward, not easy but not difficult either. It is reasonably quiet and simple to use. I use pods or tablets. It is a compact unit. If you spend a week waiting to have a full load, this is for you. One of my brothers loves the fruit/veggie washing function.  It handles standard sizes, ie., ten inch dinner plates, regular cups, but nothing extra large. Pleased so far.

title: Efficient
text: This ice maker is compact. It is easy to set up and use. It is quick and not too noisy. The nugget style cubes are chewable. There are two sizes, small and large but the size difference is negligible. It has performed consistently.

title: Nuggets
text: This ice maker is easy to use. It is fairly quiet and very efficient. It makes nugget ice. The cubes are small, soft and chewable. No odd taste. It recycles melted ice and is simple to clean. Working well so far.

title: Works Quickly
text: I liked that a bottle can be used with this ice maker. It can also be filled manually. It is pretty fast. Noise level is average. The ice comes out in sheets which you break into cubes. No storage. Melted ice gets recycled. Store ice in your freezer. The ice tastes good and is clear.

title: Sleek & Sophisticated
text: This refrigerator is well designed. It is sleek and beautiful. Simple  to set up and install it maintains the temperature. It is quiet and can be used for a variety of beverages. Love the touch panel and blue lights. An added bonus is the lock.

title: Good Cook Top
text: What I like best about this cooktop is that it can be used on a countertop or as a built in component. I have been usingnit as a countertop cooker since I am in the midst of a pandemic interrupted kitchen renovation. The directions are poor so it takes looking at videos and trial and error to figure it out. Once you understand how to work it it performs well. Nice.

title: Ice, Ice, Baby
text: So far I have had no issues with this machine. Commercial grade it is pretty easy to set up and operate. It produces nice quality, clean tree tasting ice. It is ideal for entertaining. It is not noisy. I have it at a work site where it is much appreciated.

title: Did Not Fit
text: While these cups are nicely made they did not fit my keurig 2.0 or any of my faux keurigs. The design is smart but unfortunately unusable with my machines. They are easy to fill and position. A leaflet of directions is included.

title: Okay
text: Ironically these reuseable k-cups worked well in my generic faux brewer but not in my Keurig 2.0. There are four cups, paper filters and a scoop. The scoop is great. The cups nd filters are okay. The filters make it less messy but the coffee seems to be weaker. But it is more economical than using filled cups and certainly better for the environment

title: Perfect for Small Spaces
text: This is the perfect little fridge for small spaces. Ideal for a dorm, workshop, bar or garage, it keeps things cool. The little freezer on top can make ice cubes. It is quiet and has performed well.It is lightweight and easy to move. I like it.

title: Nice Ice
text: This is a great little ice maker. Sleek and compact it is easy to use. It has no freezing capacity. You must remove the cubes or they will melt and be recycled to ice cube state again. Included is a basket and scoop to help make transfer simple. The cubes are small, bullet shaped pieces. They taste fine. The viewing window is fun. I am amazed at how quiet this machine is. Handy and fun.

title: Small Spaces, Small Loads
text: This compact washer is simple to set up. It works surprisingly well with a few caveats. First keep the loads small. This will handle underwear, socks, light tops, baby clothes not bedding, or heavily soiled items. It cleans and rinses efficiently. Clothes come out nice and clean. It is easy to use. There is a pump to help drain. It is portable and can be tucked away when not in use.

title: Space Saver
text: If you are cramped for space this dishwasher will help. The instructions are at best mediocre but I managed to set it up with only a few missteps. Once hooked up it is easy to use. It takes the detergent packs. It does a nice jib of washing and  drying dishes The five wash cycles address most needs. There is a delay wash timer so you can set it and forget it. The viewing window is fun. I was concerned about leaking but that has not been an issue. It works quite well. It is not exceptionally noisy. Pleased.

title: Simple to Use
text: This compact ice maker is simple to use. It does not store ice; you remove it to use or store in your freezer. There are no options for cube size. They are small and bullet shaped. Noise level is average and it auto stops when filled or over heating. Initially there was a plastic taste but wiping with vinegar and water remedied that.

title: Leaks
text: If you only have a little room or are camping or rv'ing this is better than nothing. It looks cute. Assembly is not difficult but the hose is too short and the clamp useless. Obviously capacity is small and the spin cycle man makes little difference in drying things off. Worse, it leaks like a sieve. If placed on a smooth surface it moves. Could have used silicone feet. I use it on a bath mat in the shower. It does wash the few items it can handle but the drawbacks outweigh the benefits.

title: Ice, Ice, Baby
text: This is a terrific machine. Easy to use it is quick and quiet. You can select different sizes of ice to suit your purpose. Large is great for cocktails, medium for smoothies and blender drinks a nab and small for keeping foods chilled. The instructions are pretty good. The ice is clear and tastes clean. Ice should be removed promptly and a scoop is included. The maker is insulated so it won't melt right away. Melted ice is recycled. It is compact and looks good on the countertop. Nice.

title: Nice Ice
text: My refrigerator's ice maker was behaving erratically so I decided to opt for a countertop version. This one is excellent. It looks sleek. Easy to use it makes nice ice fast. It is much quieter than the version in the fridge. The ice tastes good. The self cleaning feature is a plus. Have ben using it daily and am satisfied.

title: Wonderful
text: This portable dishwasher is amazing. Perfect for small spaces it is simple to set up and use. It does a terrific job. There are a number of settings: normal, rapid, fruit, steam and glass. ,The fruit option insures your produce is free of dirt. No detergent needed for this cycle.  It uses powdered dishwasher detergent or those dishwasher tabs. The capacity is small but it saves you from running the full sized washer. It is portable and ideal for rvs or camping. My kitchen isa disaster due to a pandemic interrupted andcpostponed rennovation. This countertop appliance makes life easier.

title: Ice, Ice Baby
text: This is a terrific little icemaker. Set up was simple and it is easy to use. Watching the process through the clear top window is fun, but then again I'm entertained by watching compressed mattresses puff up. In any event there are two options small cubes or large. It is efficient and not too noisy. The ice tastes good and clean, no funky plastic taste. There are indicators that let you know when to add water or when to remove the ice. It is compact and works very well.

title: Nice Ice
text: This ice maker is very easy to use. It makes bullet shaped cubes that are great in blender drinks. It is efficient but a tad noisy. Have had no performance isdues. The self cleaning function is a plus. It is super simple and does a hooid job. The ice does not store in the maker, it mudt GB be removed. Otherwise it melts and the water is recycled to make more ice. The ice tastes good and is chewable if you are into that. The unit is vom pop act and does not take up too much counter space. The ice tastes clean and fresh. There is a handle so this can be transported without fuss. Nice.

title: Limited
text: This portable dryer is limited but useful in a small place like an rv or studio apartment. Assembly was okay and it is easy to use. The wheels are helpful and it is lightweight. However it is smaller  and slower than I anticipated. I only installed the top bar.For best results don't overfill and get clothes as dry as possible before using. I run them through an extra spin cycle. Small items are best. A good stop gap measure but be aware of the limitations.

title: Nice Ice
text: This appliance is terrific. Fast and easy to use it produces bullet shaped ice. It fits easily on the counter and would be at home in a camper or rv. It has a semi automatic self clean feature. It is a time saver and works well. This ice maker is not excessively noisy. Completely satisfied.

title: Clean Machine
text: This is a terrific little machine for small spaces. I got this for our downstairs apartment and it is terrific. The wheels make it easy to move. Set up is simple and it is very easy to use.I've had no issues with leaking or performance. It does a great job with clothes and they come out fairly dry not dripping wet. More importantly, they come out clean and fresh. The unit is small and sleek. I love that it can be rolled away out of sight til the next use. Great small space solution.

title: Great Set
text: Keurigs can't be beat for convenience but the expense, limited variety and environmental impact are downsides. This set of five reusable cups addresses those concerns. They work in my 2.0 and my mini. Take care to align them properly or they won't work. The covers are attached. They are easy to clean. The scoop is handy and makes it easy to use the correct amount. It also can be clipped to your coffee canister. Nice set.

title: Works Well
text: I love my keurig but hate the high price, limited selection and environmental consequences of k-cups. This little cup fits my keurig 2.0. Made of steel it seems more durable than the plastic reusables. It comes with a starter pack of mini-filters. It is simple to assemble and use. It performs adequately and can be used with the coffee of your choice.

title: Cold Brew at Home
text: This system provides an easy alternative to commercial cold brew. The instructions are clear. Set up and use are strsightforward. I like that the brewer part separates from the pitcher. I wish the cap were better designed, either attached or somehow more securely locked. While the brewer and the pitcher nest it either sits on top or bottom. My second issue is the replaceable filters. The little sponge ones are re-useable but the paper ones are not. I am thinking of fabricating one out of cheesecloth and see if that works. The brew itself was delicious. It makes a generous amount.

title: Stove Protection
text: Stove knobs are often irresistible to toddlers. These covers are relatively easy to install and do the job. The downside is they are tough for adults to open also. I can manage but my mother who suffers from severe arthritis cannot.They are unobtrusive providing protection while not looking hideous. They do the job but are not for adults with weak or arthritic hands.

title: Lovely to look at and works great
text: Excellent product.  It chills very well.  I like the idea of a separate door for the freezer.  I discarded a small refrigerator that had one door with the small freezer inside.  It collected ice inside the walls and eventually caused failure.  The red one has automatic defrost.  Since you can open the lower door without letting ambient air into the freezer, it won't be going through the same exposure as my old single door unit.  The refrigerator section is a bit small.

title: This model has been upgraded in features
text: Out previous purchase of this K Cup coffee maker ran for many years.  This one has been upgraded in that it does not have to remain on and water kept hot.  It will make hot coffee in a couple of minutes after bring turned on.  We think this is a superior brand and model.

title: I love these babies
text: I love these babies!  They drop down inside the original K cup holder.  No need to remove it and replace it with the second holder for ground coffee.  What could be better than that?

title: For convenience, affodability, and size, this is a great choice.
text: I have purchased TWO of these; one for me and then one for my brother a little later on. For convenience, affordability, and a good fit in a small apartment, this is a wonderful choice. This machine is lightweight; it can be moved and stored easily, and it cleans clothes better than my standard machine. The drawbacks are, for best results only run small loads, it won't accommodate huge items like king-size comforters or quilts, and it does not have a built-in lint trap collection system. However, there are some very inexpensive lint collectors (a couple of dollars) that you just toss in with each wash load that float around on the surface and collect amazing amounts of lint, so that problem is solved. Now that I have owned this machine, I doubt I will ever go back to a standard size (and weight) machine again; this is just too convenient and massively more affordable. ***111

title: Quit working on the 3rd load!
text: I have been using this type of portable washer for 8 months now.  My son is bedridden after an annoxic brain injury and is now living in a nursing facility.  I do not like his personal items to be washed by the facility (I know just how filthy the bedding and things can get! I just don't want to use those items if I can help it.) So all of his rags, shirts, stuffies, braces, pillow covers,  pillows, ect.i prefer to wash. By first portable washer was a work horse! It finally broke down so I got on Amazon and bought this unit! The first wash was fine,  I really liked having the cycle button that allowed for swirling or vibration modes but this item is bigger than my old one and I had to bet a bigger bucket.  It also specified to suction to the side of the bucket instead of to the bottom but there are only a few auction cups and 2 of them wouldn't stick no matter what! So it would pop off the side and start spinning wildly in the bucket. So i switched to an old feed bucket that was flat on one side.  This worked a little better and load number two went perfectly! I was actually happy with my new larger load set up.  I then returned on another day to start load 3, NOTHING BUT GREEN FLASHY LIGHTS. Won't come on.  I tried everything.  It was dead! Now i have the hassle of returning it and ordering another.  But imma skip reordering this same unit.  Oh and the drawer to place the dertergent in........ useless...... yes it's a drawer but there are no holes anywhere inside or outside to release the dertergent.  Just 5 solid plastic walls inside.  Strange.

title: Finally the right sized filters
text:
I was literally about to replace my coffeemaker because I was tired of cleaning grinds out of the plastic bucket and finding them in my brewed coffee cup. Problem was that I bought filters from a discount store that were so short the grounds just floated right over the edge of the paper.

Last ditch decision to try these out has changed everything. Coffee grinds stay on the inside of the filter and the coffee turns out perfect again since the sides are taller. I will be buying more of these in the future.

Lesson learned.

title: This is the ABSOLUTELY PERFECT answer to K-cup single-serve coffee as you like it
text:
Wow! This is the ABSOLUTELY PERFECT answer to K-cup single-serve coffee as you like it. You can use your own coffee, filtering out the oils and getting maximum flavor, finish with the easiest cleanup for ANY of the K-cup-based systems while NOT polluting the environment in any way at all. I have literally tried every single alternative system there is for the K-cup brewer, and this is the best...hands down.
Besides being sooooo easy to set up and use for everyone in the family, I love that this system allows me to pre-fill cups and keep them in my K-cup carousel. For us, it's ease of use - We use them so quickly that there's no time for the coffee to get "stale", so that's not the issue, but if the cups did hang around a little longer, the coffee is, in fact, protected enough to stay fresh for a couple of days.
So, we are in heaven - we use our own freshly-ground coffee and get fabulous results with wonderfully easy cleanup that is environmentally-friendly. Can't get better than that!

title: Save your money! Painful to use
text:
Save your money! I found this product to be very unsatsifactory. It is super annoying to have to play with the paper filter cup and the "self-tamping" mechanism makes it impossible for me to easily put the desired amount of coffee into the cup. As a result, I have not been able to get a satisfactory cup of coffee out of it.

This is way more effort than filling the Keurig K-Cup reusable filter and I get a far better cup of coffee from the Keurig product.

Taking the time to play with this EZ-Cup is absolutely not worthwhile to me. Also, once you buy the reusable K-Cup system, there is no further money outlay, whereas with this EZ-Cup, you always have to buy their custom filter cups - at 10 cents each, that is way too expensive!

Tip for the Keurig reusable system: get a "Knock Box" and keep it on your counter. It's what used by baristas - you knock the used filter on the bar of the bax and it dumps the used grounds into the box. You can then transfer them to compost or garbage. Makes it a lot less messy and streamlines the process for making the "next cup". I have this one: [[ASIN:B0010KZCDE European Gift and Houseware 60 Stainless Steel Knock Box]], but there are other styles to choose from.

title: Perfect for my chicken coop!
text:
I'm in Alaska and temps have been -17 F every day for 2 weeks, and it's only mid-November. With 2 1/2 - 3 months of temperatures like this, my chicken would have serious frostbite and maybe even die, without some heat even in their insulated coop.

We put a radiant oil heater in the coop and use this Inkbird temperature controller to keep the heat at 34 degrees at roost level.
The controller turns the electricity that runs the heater on at 33 degrees, and off at 35. The coop temp has been very consistent and gives me peace of mind.
The floor of the coop is colder so the chickens are still acclimated to below freezing temps, but they get to rest and sleep above freezing which puts less stress in them.

The set up was a little confusing, it helped to read the reviews here to understand what PV, SV, etc meant.
Basically, set the temp for the highest you want it to go which is where you will want the heat to turn off.
Then set the differential to the number of degrees you want the heat to kick on: I set mine at 35 a the max heat I want and where the electricity will kick off. I set the differential at 2, which is 2 degrees less than my max heat of 35. This means the electric will turn on when the coop is at at 33 degrees, and will cut off when the coop temp reaches 35 degrees.

I am very happy with this unit.

title: I absolutely love my egg drawers
text: I love this thing more than anyone probably should, I really do.  We go through a lot of eggs in our house and have been buying them in the big box of 60 for quite some time now.  I had originally saved some of the smaller sized cartons and just kept refilling those as needed to keep some of the eggs easy-access, but now I don't have to do that.  I did have to put a grippy shelf liner underneath it to prevent it from sliding around on my refrigerator shelf, but that's not a big deal at all.  With this thing I can take the drawers completely out to restock them, one drawer per layer of the big box of eggs, and then slide the full drawer back into place.  It gets the big box completely out of the way and makes all of the eggs very easily accessible whenever we need them.  If we need a lot at once we can just pull an entire drawer and take it where we need it, then slide it back into place when we're done.  It keeps everything nice, neat, and perfectly accessible.  I really wish I had given in and bought this thing much sooner because I truly love it and the difference it has made for us in our kitchen.

title: No Trips to the Laundry Mat for me!!
text: We are in the middle of a huge renovation...I currently have no kitchen or laundry room.  I thought for sure I was going to have to go to a laundromat for several months, something I was dreading.  Then I came to Amazon, and sure enough...someone had invented this neat little washer/dryer!!  This little thing is amazing!  I set it in my walk-in shower, plug it in, fill it up with dirty clothes (it holds more than you would think!), fill it up with water by using the shower hose (the hose that it came with didn't fit my faucet...but no big deal), pour laundry soap in.  I wash for the full time (15 minutes).  Drain...which is oddly satisfying to watch the dirty water come out.  Then fill back up with water and fabric softener...run about a 3-minute cycle, then drain.  You can't fit the same amount into the 'spinner', so it takes a couple of loads to spin the clothes.  I only spin them for about 2 minutes, and they are surprisingly quite dry.  Then I hang everything on a clothes dryer rack.  I've been able to do a load of wash almost every evening, and it's working like a charm!  I might just keep using this even when I finally get my new laundry room!

title: Wow!! The perfect solution finally!
text: Ok, I tried 3 different options of ‘mini' washers before I bought this one. This one is a winner! The fact that it fits perfectly in my split sink makes the issue of filling, draining and protecting it in the spin mode just about perfect. It washes like a champ. I think it's better than my commercial-size washer I use for my clothes! I bought this because I have a dog that can't hold her bladder overnight so I put her in cloth dog diapers that of course need to be washed, and  I do not like to wash them in my regular washer, So this was the perfect solution! It agitates really well and as long as I don't overdo it with the detergent, I wash it, drain it, do a Rinse cycle, drain that, wring them Out by hand, and put in the spinner basket and run a spin cycle or two. The reason I say it's NEARLY perfect is because the spin cycle isnt that great. It does get some water out, but it's not fast enough to really help the drying process much. No biggie, though, because I just hang to dry in my garage. Easy peasy. Bottom line, for the $, this is an excellent little washer for baby clothes, dog diapers, or delicate items. So glad I purchased this!

text: [[VIDEOID:a8eb4dd37a0a9cb4de126feae8c300ac]] I would give this 5 ⭐'s but given the size of the dent(s) upon unboxing my machine, I can't. It still washes my laundry fairly well, but I've noticed that it bangs some when it starts the spin cycle. I believe it is because of the dent(s) on the side of the machine. I bought this brand new machine, but received it banged up. It does fit perfectly in my laundry space in my apartment bathroom. I just wish I didn't have to see the unsightly dent(s). (A little cash back because of that would be appreciated.)

title: Mighty little machine
text: I love this powerful little machine. It does a great job. I just wish the spin side was the same as the wash side. You have to scale back some on the load that you put into the spin side or it will shake very wildly. I found out that if I place the garments along the wall of the spin tub, it does not shake and does a really good job at getting out access water.

title: Great value
text: I found these by accident on Amazon. They fit but was concerned at first because of so many numbers. Match the notches up and zone in on your old one part number. Then it is so easy.

title: Too thick for my dishwasher. Said it would fit but it doesn't door won't shut with this one.
text: Too thick door won't close.

title: Just what we needed.
text: We have a front opening washer.  Unfortunately, the spot it goes in is badly located between two doors and a walkway.  If you leave the door open after washing to air it out, it is in the way.  With this gadget, it keeps the door just slightly cracked enough to dry, but closed enough to not be in the way.  It uses a magnet to hold it on.  After you are done, just move it to the side of the washer and it stays. Perfect!

title: works well
text: Not sure how necessary all the bits are that comes with the covers.  My initial kit came with everything but the holder, which is actually nice to have holding the cup steady, but not really necessary.  The covers work great.

title: Good product
text: Prompt service and excellent product. Adapting old vent pipe was a little tricky and directions a little vague, but generally resolved. The fact that it closes with excellent weather seal is the main selling point.

title: Heavy Duty, Great For Continuous Use
text: We have several nugget ice makers, this one is really streamlined, nice looking and really produces the ice as they state.  The flavor of the ice is only going to be as good as the water you use.  To keep everything clean a lot long and to preserve the life of the filter, we use our water from our reverse osmosis system for super clean water and it works fantastically.  The instructions are very clear for cleaning and operating and the machine itself is very easy to operate.  The ability to hook this one up to any water filtration system is what sets this one above and beyond the others we have tried.  This one is definitely worth every penny and I would have no problem recommending this one as your first choice when shopping for the nugget style ice makers.  I do hope you find this review helpful!

title: So Far, It's Great!
text: I actually use this unit in my bedroom so that I can have filtered clean water and ice readily available for either in the middle of the night or when I first wake up.  We already have all of this out in our kitchen area and I wanted this for my bedroom and so far it is working fantastically.  Easy to fill, easy to operate, easy to clean.  So far, I really have no complaints about this unit whatsoever.  I have used several different ice makers in the past and currently and this is one of the better ones for sure.  I just fill the water container with our water from our reverse osmosis system so it's super affordable for us too.  The price is quite reasonable as well and I would recommend this icemaker/water dispenser to anyone who is looking for a dual solution like this.  Saves on space too if you do not want to have a bunch of water pitchers with purified water sitting around.  I hope you find this review helpful!

title: So Far, Really Great
text: We already had another nugget ice maker, but by an unknown brand and it works fantastic however, when we saw this one become available by a name brand I have trusted since I was a kid, I wanted to give them a fair shot.  Make not mistake though, when you order a nugget ice maker, most of them are quite large so keep that in mind when ordering because if you do not have the space for it, best to wait until you do.  That also means clearance space around the unit as these ice makers need plenty of ventilation for the fan to work properly and not burn out your motor.  This ice maker in particularly is fantastic!  It produces ice really fast, easy to set up, instructions are very clear and complete (unlike our last one, that was the only downfall to the other one), this machine is worth every last penny.  We haven't had it long, but so far it is fantastic- 44 lbs of ice in a day and it takes only about 30 minutes to fill up the bin entirely.  The different compartments is very interesting, something we are not used to with any of our other units, but I actually prefer the way Frigidaire decided to construct it this way.  In other brands, usually your ice basket hovers above the water, in this one, there are two separate compartments, with the water container being on top and you just slide it open, lift the little lid and fill.  The reason I like this feature better is because often, if your ice basket is sitting on top of the water, and someone accidentally puts just a little too much water in the reservoir, it melts the ice you just made.  With this unit, that is not even a thing.  I would definitely recommend this ice maker if you are wanting a nugget maker and I am truly glad these are finally becoming more affordable for home use!  I hope you find this review helpful!

title: Great Addition To My Coffee Station
text: This filter holder is well crafted and really cute.  It works great at holding our filters, but the bonus is, it actually makes pulling individual filters out much easier.  If you know, then you know.  Sometimes, just getting one filter at a time out of the box can be a struggle, for whatever reason, placing the filters in a filter holder like this one actually makes it easier.  It also adds a great accent to the entire coffee station and I am glad I grabbed it.  This is also a highly giftable gadget for any coffee lover that owns a maker that requires these type of filters.  I hope this review is helpful!

title: Perfect Range Hood
text: Where to start, the range hood out of the box was impressively stunning in looks, which is not something that is high priority on my list.  Of course I want it to look nice, but I has seen some that are just awesome looking and they turn out to be complete junk.  I am happy to report that this range hood does an incredible job at suction, it's quiet even on the highest fan setting.  The LED lights are not blinding but they provide the perfect amount of light for me.  I love the touch buttons rather than the knobs, much easy to control.  We needed a replacement/updated range hood badly.  Ours was so bad that instead of exhausting like it was supposed to, it would just blow the smoke out everywhere in the house instead of up and out.  It was definitely time for an upgrade either way.  And the price is really reasonable for something this nice that works perfectly.  I highly recommend this one, zero issues so far and we have had it for 3 months going on strong.  I will update with pictures once I can locate the pictures I took.  Hope this review is helpful!

title: Superb Replacement or Upgrade
text: After reading reviews before purchasing, we were cautiously optimistic that it would fit into our older mobile home, which is not the home we live in.  We have 2 homes on our property, the other home is what we keep for family when they come to visit since hotels really are not a thing here in our tiny town.  Surprisingly, out of the box the craftsmanship was great and had easy to follow, clear instructions for installation and with just a few modifications to our cabinetry, it fit great.  We over-estimated it fitting into our space so it wasn't quite big enough, only short by like an inch and a half, so that is where the modification to our cabinet came into play, we didn't have to modify the range hood at all.  Once installed we were really impressed with the subtle fan noise on both speeds.  The LED lights were also not overwhelmingly bright, they were quite perfect for the space over the oven.  For this price point, I can highly recommend this range hood for a replacement or an upgrade.  Hope this review is helpful!!

title: easy as it gets
text: I've used a coffee press for a long time. Unfortunately before leaving for an extended trip I neglected to wash it before leaving and came home to a science experiment. A couple of go rounds in the dish washer and soaks in bleach and it couldn't be salvaged. Frustrated with the effort required to clean the press and the realization that even when it's clean it isn't quite as clean as I'd like, I decide I'd go even simpler and give this Ready Set Joe a try. I usually have two or more cups in the morning so I use an oversized filter heat up about 18-20 oz of water ,put Ready Set Joe over a container of equal size throw my desired amount of coffee in.. Slowly pour the hot water over the grounds...(running a few splashes of water to wet the filter prior improves the speed that the brewing coffee flows through).  I like this drip method very much and don't miss the daily hassle of cleaning out the coffee press. Tastes great. I am going to buy one to travel with. I like the red color it is easy to spot! So easy and hassle-free that I think I'll go brew a cup now.

Instead I got some cheap knock off (seller Modern Home Products) in separate packaging, with little evidence it is Cuisinart.  These are definitely not the same, the Cuisinart ones were always stretched "pregnant" with carbon, this one has room to spare inside a lower rent cover.  The newer one actually fits in the black holder better for it, but of course, activated carbon is expensive, and cutting 15% of it out is going to make a reseller happy.  I absolutely hate to be duped by Amazon listings this way, so feel compelled to report here.  That said, you probably can get by fine with this cheap knockoff if that is what you think you are buying.

title: When you are tired of drinking Teflon chips in your drinks...
text:
Direct replacement, only had to replace my original wiring harness to the new Ice Maker and On/Off/Ice level sensor arm, and we were making ice. I have had this unit in for more than 24 hrs and although it does produce Ice, it makes ice at half the rate of the original. All Freezer settings are the same, no changes made when I installed the new Ice Maker. Not sure why, am sure someone will suggest that the unit has to get to operating temp in order to start making ice at a faster pace. Funny, when I had removed and reinstalled the original Ice maker it would make the fist batch of Ice in 4 hrs and fill up the bin with Ice 14-16 hrs later. This unit has only produced 1/3 of the bin worth of Ice in a 16 hr time span.

The Teflon coating is not Black, like pictured, more like a Tan color similar to the OEM Ice Maker. For now I am happy that I am not drinking chips of Teflon from the old maker. Hope this unit works for more than a year and does not peel up.

title: Do it right the first time and you won't have to fight with the dryer.
text: My 20 year old dryer decided that it was going to heat at it's hottest setting to the point of scalding my hands when removing the clothes from the dryer and causing a major case of wrinkles in my work Polo's. After going to YouTube to find out how to diagnose the issue, I found that there are a few things to check. First thing you will need to do is open the back of the dryer, with it unplugged, and check the Thermal Fuse. This can be done with a multi-meter or temporarily jump the two connectors/blade terminals and check if the Dryer runs at the correct temp for all cycles. Since I had the dryer taken apart I figured I would clean out the blower fan area and the fan ducting as well as the entire "innards" of the dryer. After temporarily jumping the thermal fuse I found that it had kicked the bucket as the dryer started to work again due to jumping out the fuse. Did I say that this dryer is 20 years old and the original fuse lasted that long? So I decided that since I have the thing open I might as well replace the other 20 Year old electrical components that were back there. These Items included: the Thermal Fuse, Cycling Thermostat, High Limit Dryer Thermostat and Dryer Thermal cut off. Each have their own job and purpose, so don't skimp out and think you can get away with changing the item that has failed, because if that item failed the others will follow. Did I mention my Dryer is 20 years old? As A side note; I also checked the Heating Element and found that one of the coils had warped and contacted/welded itself the the element body, this is what took out the fuse. A pair of needle nose pliers and a steady hand detached the coil and re-positioned the coil in its original shape and placement. My 20 year old dryer, that was a wedding gift to my wife when she married her fist husband now works like a champ!

title: MUCH better than the original drip tray that came with our GE refrigerator
text:
We have a relatively new GE refrigerator: we moved into our current home in August 2012, and our refrigerator was new at that time, so it is less than three years old. We had a GE model in our old home as well, and although that one was over 12 years old, the drip tray was in perfect condition. Unfortunately, the drip tray on our current model (GSCS3PGXSS) was much more poorly made, being cheap plastic that was coated to appear a faux stainless to match the refrigerator. In the brief time we have owned this new refrigerator, the coating has chipped away, exposing black plastic underneath. Even worse, this problem has allowed bacteria to form, as we have been unable to adequately clean and sanitize the tray.

My husband began searching for a replacement. On the manufacturer's web site, they were charging over SIXTY dollars for this replacement part (not including shipping). As much as this problem was an issue for us, there was NO WAY we were going to pay that amount. Luckily, after further research, my husband found that this replacement part appeared to be the right size for our refrigerator. This was somewhat difficult to determine for several reasons. First, plugging our model number into Amazon search feature at the top of the item listing did not work; it just said "model not found." Second, Amazon lists the WRONG dimensions for this item. The dimensions Amazon has listed are the SHIPPING dimensions; the actual item dimensions are approximately 7.5" wide and 4" deep.

A final concern was that this drip tray was black, not faux stainless steel like the original that came with our refrigerator as well as the refrigerator itself. We thought that this would probably be fine, and you can see from the photo that I included that we were absolutely right! The black tray actually looks BETTER than the original, as it provides a nice contrast with the refrigerator and matches the digital display. This drip tray also seems better made, and we feel confident that it will last longer than the other. And finally, we paid less than ten dollars! We are only sorry we waited this long to replace the old tray.
